intro: Phyllocosmus dewevrei, commonly known as the African violet, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are adapted for pollination by specific insect species. The plant is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
